title: Troubleshooting Valve Issues Using A Voltmeter

tasks.task: Troubleshoot a malfunctioning sprinkler system zone using a voltmeter.
subtasks: Identify the problem (zone won't stop running, won't come on fully, or won't come on at all).
Check the controller's voltage output for the affected zone.
Measure resistance on the valve's solenoid using the voltmeter.
Check wiring connections at the valve box for continuity.
Replace faulty valve or wiring components as necessary.

tasks.task: Upgrade or replace a malfunctioning controller.
subtasks: Assess controller compatibility and available terminals.
Replace faulty modules or upgrade to a smart controller.
Check for program errors or module seating issues.
Consider smart controller features (e.g., smartphone integration).
Purchase and install a new controller if needed.

tasks.task: Identify electrical components involved in valve activation.
subtasks: Understand the role of the controller, solenoid, and common wire.
Differentiate between AC and DC solenoids.
Research valve and solenoid resistance specifications online.
Transitional step for battery-operated controllers (not applicable here).
